Package voltage.core

Class VoltageKnob

java.lang.Object
voltage.core.VoltageComponent
voltage.core.VoltageKnob
public class VoltageKnob
extends VoltageComponent
Knobs - the staple of modular systems.

  • Constructor Details

    • VoltageKnob

      public VoltageKnob​(java.lang.String internalName, java.lang.String displayName, VoltageModule module, double min, double max, double startValue)
      Creates a knob.
      Parameters:
      internalName - the control's name
      displayName - the name the user sees
      module - the owner of this control
      min - the minimum value
      max - the maximum value
      startValue - the starting/default value of this control

    • VoltageKnob

      public VoltageKnob​(java.lang.String name, VoltageModule module, double min, double max, double startValue)
      Creates a knob.
      Parameters:
      name - the control's name
      module - the owner of this control
      min - the minimum value
      max - the maximum value
      startValue - the starting/default value of this control

  • Method Details

    • GetDefaultValue

      public double GetDefaultValue()

      Returns:
      the default value.

    • SetRange

      public void SetRange​(double min, double max, double startValue, boolean bShowLevelFromCenterPos, int numberOfStops)
      Sets the range and other knob settings.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum value
      max - the maximum value
      startValue - the default value
      bShowLevelFromCenterPos - sets this up like a pan control.
      numberOfStops - The number of stops/discrete values.

    • DisplayValueInPercent

      public void DisplayValueInPercent​(boolean displayPercent)
      Is this a % control?
      Parameters:
      displayPercent - if true, it will display tooltips as a percentage.

    • SetRingSkin

      public void SetRingSkin​(java.lang.String skinName)
      Sets the outer ring skin. A ring around the knob can be used to indicate the current setting or the current value.
      Parameters:
      skinName - the resource name of the ring skin.

    • GetRingSkin

      public java.lang.String GetRingSkin()
      Returns the name of the ring skin resource.
      Returns:
      the name of the ring skin resource.

    • SetKnobAdjustsRing

      public void SetKnobAdjustsRing​(boolean bKnobSetsRing)
      Sets the knob's value to adjust the ring.
      Parameters:
      bKnobSetsRing - set to true to have the knob value adjust the ring.

    • GetKnobAdjustsRing

      public boolean GetKnobAdjustsRing()
      Does the knob adjust the ring?
      Returns:
      does the knob adjust the ring?

    • SetRingValue

      public void SetRingValue​(double zeVal)
      Sets the knob's ring value.
      Parameters:
      zeVal - the value to set the ring.

    • GetRingValue

      public double GetRingValue()
      Gets the ring value.
      Returns:
      the value of the ring.

    • SetMidpointValue

      public void SetMidpointValue​(double value)
      Sets the mid point of the knob.
      Parameters:
      value - the middle point of the knob.

    • SetRangeSkewValue

      public void SetRangeSkewValue​(double value, boolean skewFromCenter)
      Sets how this knob skews.
      Parameters:
      value - the skew value adjusts how the knob adjusts from the midpoint value. if less than 1.0 will fill more value into the lower range. Otherwise, it will place more value into the higher range.
      skewFromCenter - should it skew from the center?

    • GetMidpointValue

      public double GetMidpointValue()
      Gets midpoint value.
      Returns:
      the midpoint.

    • IsSkewedFromCenter

      public boolean IsSkewedFromCenter()
      Is it skewed from the center?
      Returns:
      true if it's skewed from the center.

    • GetRangeSkewValue

      public double GetRangeSkewValue()
      Gets the skew range value. if less than 1.0 values skew more to the lower range. if greater than 1.0 values skew more to the higher range.
      Returns:
      the range skew value.

    • HasNonLinearRange

      public boolean HasNonLinearRange()
      Is this knob non-linear? IE: Does it skew?
      Returns:
      true if it skews or is non-linear.

    • SetKnobParams

      public void SetKnobParams​(float startAngleDeg, float endAngleDeg)
      Set the start and end angle.
      Parameters:
      startAngleDeg - the start angle of the knob.
      endAngleDeg - the ending angle of the knob.

    • SetMouseSensitivity

      public void SetMouseSensitivity​(double sensitivity)
      Sets the knob sensitivity.
      Parameters:
      sensitivity - sets the mouse sensitivity indicating how far the mouse has to drag to traverse the whole range of the knob (0.1 to 4.0 ) Normal sensitivity is 1.0

    • SetValue

      Overrides:
